page.title: 01Position Of Mulben
page.content: Our Domesday Block lies mostly within the Parish of Boharm, with a small section to the South within the Parish of Botriphnie. It is situated in the North_East of Scotland in the Eastern part of Moray district, which is in the Western part of Grampian Region. Before the re_organisation of local government in 1975, it was within the central part of the County of Banffshire. The road through this area is the A95 Class 1 Road from Banff to Grantown_on _Spey. It runs from Keith to Mulben, and crosses the River Spey some miles to the West. To the north of the area lies the hill of Mulderie _311 metres above sea level.The upper slopes have been planted by the Forrestry Commission. There are 14 farms in our Block _with mixed farming mostly being done.
